column2: Android library that allows launching a custom activity when your app crashes, instead of showing the hated "Unfortunately, X has stopped" dialog.

column5: Relog the stack trace by default when the error activity is started (and allow disabling this behavior). Closes #35.
Fix some Lint warnings and update to latest tools/libraries

Merge pull request #40 from coffeemakr/master

Correct null annotations
Fix main app activity becoming duplicated in the back stack after restarting the app from the error activity. Probably related to #29.
Change order so it matches methods
Allow disabling the exception handler and make restart loop time configurable
Add new background mode (crash) and update documentation
Don't set anything by default in the sample
Don't crash if theme is not properly set
Replace CircularFifoQueue with ArrayDeque to avoid Apache dependency
Make activity tracking tracking optional (and rename methods).

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/bourmhe/CustomActivityOnCrash into bourmhe-master

Conflicts:
	library/build.gradle
	library/src/main/java/cat/ereza/customactivityoncrash/CustomActivityOnCrash.java
Use builder pattern for config, use AppCompat and autoinitialization, and don't show build date if not present. Fixes #26, #28, #30, #31.
Track user actions through the activities lifecycle

- Close #17, #18, #19, #21.
- Use default exception handler when an error occurs in application or error activity classes, or when a restart loop is detected.
- Prepare for 1.5.0 release.
Allow specifying a drawable or mipmap to use on the default error activity with a method.

Merge pull request #14 from Sloy/master

Copy error information to clipboard

Copy error information to clipboard

Added a button to the error information AlertDialog to copy the error text to the clipboard.
Update readme with process name change
Force the error activity and restart activity to clear all the task stack. Should fix #9.
Stop using a string resource for the process name, this appears to only be supported on recent APIs. This means the process will always be killed when restarting.
Clarify comments and fix hardcoded string

-Fixed #8. Now the process is only used on API<17, and when restarting the app, the error process is killed. This should avoid multiprocess issues.
-Updated gradle version and readme.

-Naming and code style fixes to AizazAZ's pull request
-Use the same approach for error activity: allow specifying it at manifest level
Add an image to the readme
Nicer looking default error activity and code cleanup
Enable custom activity in the sample
Clarify the sample and adjust readme
Explain how to customize the default error activity

* Improve the default error activity handling.
* Deprecate old init methods and use new methods that allow changing the settings at any time.
* Rename all resources so they can't clash with any other the user might be using.

Merge pull request #2 from gitskarios/develop

Add material style in sample
Add library to Maven Central and remove lint warnings
Remove thread creation during shutdown, crashed on API>=21
Simplify method naming and expand the readme
Try not to crash if application init or error activity fail
Limit intent size to 128KB and fix activity not being launched in API<17
Evolve the sample into a library so it can be added via Gradle with no code changes.

Merge pull request #1 from rocboronat/master

Only calls registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks() when the Android version is >=14
Only calls registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks() when the Android version is >=14
Don't use an alarm to launch the intent, this is what ACRA does and it should work better everywhere.
